Package ohos.agp.components

Class ColumnSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.ColumnSystem

  • public class ColumnSystem
extends Object
    Represents a responsive layout design mechanism that can accommodate different screen sizes and orientations. The column system can be used as an auxiliary positioning tool for UI layout to ensure consistent experience across devices.

    The column system has three basic attributes: column, gutter, and margin.

    • Columns are used for positioning in the UI layout. The positioning for different screen sizes is determined by the number of columns. The column width is automatically calculated based on the actual device width and the number of columns when the margins and gutters meet the specifications.
    • Gutters are used to control the spacing between elements. You can define different gutter values based on the screen sizes to serve as the unified specifications for breakpoints. To achieve a sound visual effect, set the gutter value to one not greater than the margin value.
    • Margins are used to control the padding between elements and edges of a screen. You can define different margins based on the screen sizes to serve as the unified specifications for breakpoints.
    Since:
    7

      • DIALOG_TYPE

        public static final int DIALOG_TYPE
        Indicates the dialog column type.

        This column type can be automatically adapted to four sub-types based on the window size and window width/height ratio:

        • Window size < 12 and window width/height ratio > 9:16
        • Window size < 12 and window width/height ratio <= 9:16
        • Window size >= 12 and window width/height ratio > 9:16
        • Window size >= 12 and window width/height ratio <= 9:16
        Since:
        7
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getTotalColumnCount

        public int getTotalColumnCount​()

        Returns:

        Since:
        7

      • getSuggestedWidth

        public int getSuggestedWidth​()
        Obtains the width for the current column type.

        When you create a ColumnSystem instance using ColumnSystem(ohos.app.Context), the return value is the width for the default column type. When you create a ColumnSystem instance using ColumnSystem(ohos.app.Context,int), the return value is the width for the specified column type. For the column type that uses a width range, for example, ColumnSystem.SINGLE_BUTTON_TYPE, the return value is the minimum width.

        Returns:
        Returns the width for the current column type.
        Since:
        7

      • getColumnWidth

        public float getColumnWidth​(int columnCount)
        Obtains the total width of a specified number of columns.
        Parameters:
        columnCount - Indicates the number of columns.
        Returns:
        Returns the total width of the specified number of columns. For example, value 6 indicates the total width of six columns and five gutters.
        Since:
        7

      • getMinColumnWidth

        public int getMinColumnWidth​()
        Obtains the minimum column width of a specified column type.
        Returns:
        Returns the minimum column width if the specified column type, for example, ColumnSystem.SINGLE_BUTTON_TYPE, uses a width range; returns a fixed value if the specified column type uses a fixed width.
        Since:
        7

      • getMaxColumnWidth

        public int getMaxColumnWidth​()

        Returns:

        Since:

      • updateConfiguration

        public int updateConfiguration​(Context context)
        Sets the effective area of the column system to complete window.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Returns:
        Returns the column width used by the current column type if the setting is successful; returns the previous value if the setting has failed.
        Since:
        7

      • updateConfiguration

        public int updateConfiguration​(int width,
                               int height,
                               float density)
        Sets the effective area of the column system to partial window.
        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the width of the effective area.
        height - Indicates the height of the effective area.
        density - Indicates the screen density of the effective area. Generally, the value of density is the same as that on the device.
        Returns:
        Returns the column width used by the current column type if the setting is successful; returns the previous value if the setting has failed.
        Since:
        7
